posts.description: A concept i had in mind the other day and decided to paint it...

Tribute to my favorite Miyazaki movie of all time. Princess Mononoke portrays the beauty and challenges of coexisting with mother nature so perfectly. It teaches a lesson that we can all learn from. If you haven't seen this classic already, I highly recommend it :)

In other news, I'll be at Anime Expo this year at tables A/B 37 and 38 with books, posters, and more! See you there! :D

Isegrim!!! remember him? probably not.

This is last time we drew him, which was ages ago, but I love his character a lot and I want to draw more stuff with him in nearest future because i love ice. 

(this image is a real mess, I need to plan composition better, oh well)

I'll always be here, behind you

I'll provide full normal speed video process on my patreon:www.patreon.com/wlop

You can also support me on creating my own comic Ghostblade on my patreon: www.patreon.com/wlop

Did a sketch on monday of a skull & gasmask combo....its looked cool so i spent a few more hours and here is the result:)

as for the whole tie thing....well the poor junk-bot just wants to fit in and look as smart as the rest of man kind:)

i really didnt want much colour in this at all so that the tie could stand out strongest.

also didnt work too much on the background, wanted more focus on the character.

ok enough ranting.....enjoy:P
Make up the background story as you please, I erased mine I think it's better everybody sees their own story in this.

Breaking lights of darkness in the distance,
Flickering apologetic words,
Subconsciously passive, last resistance
I just want to atomize, shatter out of consistence
Flying into heavens like a flock of birds.

Counting down nanoseconds of my toll.
Tracing down the lines of existence
And these words of wisdom overdue for all
It is far too late for heavenly assistance,
When my sins accounted for the ending goal

Body’s rusting in the rain,
I am trying to forget and be forgotten.
Something clawing from the inside at my brain,
Something ghastly, dark and rotten.

Hear me and thus accept my flesh
Take my eyes so I can see again
Maybe then I can no longer be forsaken
Maybe then I can awaken, 
Start my life anew, afresh.
(welcome to use this image to other web page of art, hope link back to here or credit, thank you support

Painted this over Livestream in about 4 hours, you can view the full recording at my new Youtube channel. Thank you very much to all who stayed and watched! I have always loved all imagery of Sherlock Holmes playing the violin, I find it very striking and it's one of his most recognizable and interesting character traits. This piece is inspired by BBC's Sherlock (I cannot possibly recommend this show more!) 

Time-lapsed process video can be watched here. Drawn and painted in Adobe Photoshop with a Wacom tablet. Reference from here.

Available to buy as a phone case and other products here.


EDIT 10/09/13: I have provided this high-res wallpaper as a COURTESY to fellow Sherlock fans, and I expect my work to be treated with respect. Time and time again I have seen art thieves download this painting, PHOTOSHOP OUT MY SIGNATURE, and re-upload it to their own websites as a "free wallpaper," or, even worse, print it as a poster or on a phone case to sell on eBay, Amazon, Etsy, StoreEnvy, etc. It's absolutely ridiculous and disappointing. I'm leaving the wallpaper up because I know most don't do that, but I'm going to say this once again since it's apparently not clear: DO NOT REMOVE MY SIGNATURE FROM THIS ARTWORK FOR ANY REASON . If you see this painting on any of the above sites, please do me a favor and report it. If you see this painting on any products or websites without credit to me, I ask you not to buy it, and JUST REPORT IT. Thank you.

This is a little thank you gift for :icontechgnotic: who was a pleasure to talk with during the interview hq.deviantart.com/journal/Flas…

He is so sincere about what he does and truly loves his job at dA. It's just so great to get to know people like him who is living his dream.
